intro: Illicium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered star anise, is a species of flowering plant in the family Schisandraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped fruits that are similar in appearance to the more well-known star anise (Illicium verum). It typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories and can reach heights of up to 5 meters. The plant's botanical features include simple, alternate leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters.
